subject: Self Care
title: Emotions as Data
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Emotions as Data.

hook.text: Anger, fear, and sadness aren't problems. They're information. Emotionally intelligent people read the signal.

buildup.text: Every emotion carries a message. Anger signals a boundary violation. Fear signals a perceived threat ahead.

discovery.text: Sadness signals loss. Guilt signals a values conflict. Anxiety signals uncertainty about the future.

twist.text: Suppressing emotions doesn't remove them. It removes the data. You make worse decisions when you ignore signals.

climax.text: Treat every emotion as a notification. Read it, extract the message, then decide what action to take.

punchline.text: Emotions are signals. Read them, don't silence them.

quiz.question: According to the emotions-as-data model, what does anger signal?
